data.title: Just One More Wave: A Good Lesson for Life
data.meta_description: My paternal grandparents were explorers by nature. On one fateful occasion, driving along the highway coast of the Mexican Pacific in the early seventies, they found a gravel detour from the main…
data.text:
My paternal grandparents were explorers by nature. On one fateful occasion, driving along the highway coast of the Mexican Pacific in the early seventies, they found a gravel detour from the main road a good hour and a half before reaching Puerto Vallarta. The track ventured straight into the jungle — in the direction of the shoreline, still invisible from the road.

They perhaps looked at each other for a moment, then turned their menthe-colored 1950s Jeep Wagoneer onto the mysterious path, slowly traversing two miles deeper and deeper into the jungle. Eventually, they went up a hill—from where they probably gasped at the view of the immense blue ocean below them—and then drove down, down, down, over bumps, rocks, and fallen branches, avoiding iguanas eating fallen mangos on the road.

As they approached the end of the path, the velvet crashing of waves could be heard. The shore was near.

In a serene clearing, they suddenly saw a long, one-floor rectangular home. Its…
